meanings.definition: Involving, caused by, or of the nature of a physical or mental disease
meanings.sent1: Her pathological fear of spiders made it difficult for her to even look at a picture of one.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed him with a pathological condition that required immediate treatment.
meanings.sent3: His pathological aversion to vegetables led to some creative meal planning.
meanings.sent4: The city's neglect of the park was pathological, resulting in overgrown weeds and broken benches.
meanings.sent5: The pathological growth of the tumor required urgent surgical intervention.

meanings.sent1: She had a pathological need to check the locks on the doors multiple times before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: His pathological need for order and cleanliness made him a meticulous organizer.
meanings.sent3: His pathological obsession with collecting stamps filled every corner of his house.
meanings.sent4: The company's pathological focus on profit above all else led to unethical practices.
meanings.sent5: Her pathological need for approval drove her to constantly seek validation from others.

meanings.sent1: The movie's violence reached a pathological level that left many viewers disturbed.
meanings.sent2: His pathological love for spicy food led him to carry hot sauce everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The team's pathological dedication to winning every game sometimes bordered on obsession.
meanings.sent4: The politician's pathological need for attention overshadowed his actual policies.
meanings.sent5: Her pathological fear of failure drove her to work tirelessly to succeed in every endeavor.
